docs.abstract: As many as one-third of the elderly die owing more in medical fees than they have in assets, according to a new study.
docs.snippet: As many as one-third of the elderly die owing more in medical fees than they have in assets, according to a new study.

docs.abstract: A former Obama aide criticized a new ad by a Republican "super PAC" for featuring a fictional family suffering from President Obama's economic policies.
docs.snippet: A former Obama aide criticized a new ad by a Republican "super PAC" for featuring a fictional family suffering from President Obama's economic policies.

docs.lead_paragraph: The state is looking into whether two insurance firms effectively bought their dominant positions by paying kickbacks to banks disguised as commissions or other business.

headline.seo: New York Investigates Home Insurer Payments to Banks
headline.main: New York Investigates Insurer Payments to Banks
headline.print_headline: New York Investigates Insurer Payments to Banks

docs.abstract: New York State is investigating whether insurance firms Assurant and QBE Insurance effectively bought their dominant positions by paying kickbacks to banks disguised as commissions or other business; two insurers control 90 percent of the market for force-placed insurance, which mortgage lenders take out when borrowers stop making payments on their homeowners' insurance.
docs.snippet: The state is looking into whether two insurance firms effectively bought their dominant positions by paying kickbacks to banks disguised as commissions or other business.

docs.lead_paragraph: Direct primary care providers, which were once most associated with concierge health services for the rich, are reaching out to small businesses and the working class.

headline.seo: Direct Primary Care Providers Lower Cost of Concierge Services
headline.main: More Care Up Front for $54 a Month
headline.print_headline: More Care Up Front For $54 A Month

docs.abstract: Direct primary care providers, who offer unlimited access to doctors in exchange for a monthly fee, are beginning to target small businesses and the working class; model, which eschews traditional insurance, originally catered only to the affluent.
docs.snippet: Direct primary care providers, which were once most associated with concierge health services for the rich, are reaching out to small businesses and the working class.

docs.lead_paragraph: Forty-three groups are challenging the Obama administration’s rule that employees receive health insurance coverage for contraception.

headline.main: Catholics File Suits on Contraceptive Coverage

docs.abstract: Forty-three Roman Catholic groups file lawsuits in 12 federal courts to challenge the Obama administration rule requiring that employees receive coverage for contraception in their health insurance policies; suit claims that mandate is an unprecedented attack on their religious beliefs.
docs.snippet: Forty-three groups are challenging the Obama administration’s rule that employees receive health insurance coverage for contraception.

keywords.value: Patient Protection and Affordable Care Act (2010)
keywords.name: subject

docs.lead_paragraph: A conversation with the economist Dana Goldman, who believes that prevention should drive health care reimbursement.

headline.main: A Long View on Health Care: Think Like an Investor
headline.print_headline: A Long View on Health Care: Think Like an Investor

docs.abstract: Interview with economist Dana Goldman, who believes that preventive care should drive health care reimbursement.
docs.snippet: A conversation with the economist Dana Goldman, who believes that prevention should drive health care reimbursement.
